intro: Myriocladus neblinaensis, commonly known as the cloud forest spurge, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the high humidity and cool temperatures of its habitat. Its ecological role includes providing shelter and food for various invertebrates and small vertebrates. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
